name: The Zanzibari

reviews.text: Overall it was a pleasant, albeit expensive stay at this very very quiet hotel. I would agree with other comments that is fairly expensive for what you get; and more importantly, compared to similar offerings around the area.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel needs to be commended on the service staff -- really helpful, welcoming and attentive. Dont be expecting promptness though, but that´s more of an island/location trait that is not isolated to this establishment.
reviews.title: A VERY PLEASANT STAY WE ENJOYED VERY MUCH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another highlight is the food. Due to its relatively isolated location, we tended to have all meals in the hotel. The quality of the food/drinks was outstanding. Breakfast and dinner was included in the price of the room. This was probably the biggest plus of our entire stay.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the hotel does not face any big expansive beach. But little what is out there is really gorgeous. One of the most beautiful stretches of sand that I have seen. In all fairness, having explored the area, you´d be better off sunning in the privacy of the hotel than on the beaches (especially if you´re a woman). If you´re looking for long stretches of sand, where you can relax and chill without being disturbed, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: We loved it and we WILL be back!

reviews.text: The hotel was pratically dead while we were staying. It was my party and two other couples. There was absolutely nothing to do at night in the hotel nor within walking distance either. To head to ¨town¨ it is best to hire a taxi. It didnt feel safe to be walking around the area, nor on the beach at night.
reviews.title: well pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where to start ...
reviews.title: Crazy expensive for what you get

reviews.text: Upon arrival you are asked if there are any alergies, etc .. I am lactose intolerant and believed that this questionaire would mean some care in the meals served .. but not. In most cases desert was off limits for me and there weren´t other options. After making friends with a couple of waiters I started to get fruit for desert and was alloud to have certain dishes without the cream/cheese/milk sauces. Food in general is good but very repetitive in ingredients. The restaurant and pool staff are wonderfull, we only have kind words for them! The recepcioninst is condescending in tone but zero effective and the manager, Mr. Eugene is very nice and a great PR but seemded a very poor manager.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but don't expect a beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (number 8) was nice looking and appeared clean, but the bed is unconfortably high (about 1,30m) and the bathroom needs urgent remodeling. The water pressure is very weak and there is limited quantity of hot water (after a shower of 15 minutes there is not enough hot water for the next person). In our bathroom, every time it rained we would have a flood.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: We were in during the rainy season and having arrived after a mud safari we needed to do some washing. The hotel provides the service and we were warned that clothes might take a couple of days to be ready due to the humidity. I asked if they had a tumble dryer and I was informed that yes but anyway the clothes would need to stay out for a while because the dryer is not enough .. this sounded strange but we believed. 3 days after giving the clothes to wash we had a basquet with our clothes left outside of our bedroom door (outside were everyone can see and touch) still wet and with an awfull stench!!! When we confronted the manager about it I was told that it was the best they could do as they don´t have a tumble dryer and depend on the sun to dry their clothes. They washed up again and for the remaining days of our stay our bedroom was a drying facility with clothes hanging all over. We managed to dry everything in time!! In general the towels, bed sheets and table napkins were humid, stained and smelled strange.
reviews.title: your own private paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To summarize the only reason I would go back to "The Zanzibari" would be to visit the restaurant and pool staff .. to expensive for the service offered and no way a boutique hotel!! In our walks through the area we found nicer and less expensive places ...
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful

reviews.text: If you are looking for somewhere beautiful, private and relaxing, this is definitely where you want to be! The service was excellent, the food to die for, and the location perfect. And for a really good price. I sincerely hope I can return one day...
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.text: We really needed a relaxing holiday and that is exactly what we got. The surroundings were beautiful and the view of the sea endlessly captivating. Every member of staff was helpful, friendly and courteous and went out of their way to make our stay a wonderful experience. The food was truly excellent, lots of variety and choice. I really have nothing negative to say about our stay, we normally find it very difficult to just sit still and relax but here it was easy! Thank you!
reviews.title: The Zanzibari was such a great place to chill out we extended our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the title suggests we headed out to Zanzibar and the Zanzibari to relax and enjoy the start of married life! Eugene and his staff were excellent all the way through from initial enquiries, to the welcome and throughout our stay. The team obviously care about their guests and do their utmost to ensure their stay is enjoyable and hassle free - not always easy in Africa! An oasis close, but far enough away, from the growing madness of Nungwi proper. We stayed in one to the suites with our own infinity pool and took the honeymoon package, loved it! The food was excellent and a surprisingly good wine list, an amazing setting and view just over the beach (which is tide dependent) but it was the service and attention of the staff that make this place special! Thanks guys really enjoyed it!
reviews.title: A Honeymoon to remember!

reviews.text: The Zanzibari is paradise on Earth! A group of 9 friends and I stayed over New Years Eve and we couldn't ask for more. We rented 2 private guest houses that gave us more than enough space. The houses were modern (had large flat screen tv- though we were too busy to ever watch them!) and had views that literally took your breath away. The houses had private pools and were steps away from the main pool. The service was amazing! The staff became our good friends who would do anything to make the trip more enjoyable. The owner was amazing and accommodating even when we had difficulties with our credit cards (he let us pay in both US and shillings). I should note that one must have a credit card not a debit/credit card combo because this will not work. It caused a bit of a problem for us, but we worked it out. The meals were amazing! Some of the best food I had in Africa! The tours were also amazing! I recommend the Sunset Cruise and snorkeling to Mnemba Island. Both were well worth the money. Also well worth the money is the massages they offer. Imagine laying in a beach hut, listening to the waves, as a petite woman gives you the most relaxing aroma therapy massage. HEAVEN! I will note that as a group of ten 20 somethings that this isn't the place to go party. However, the staff was more than happy to help us book transportation to local hotspots like Kendwa. I couldn't have asked for a better stay!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Zanzibari for 3 nights in late April (the rainy/low season) and had a lovely time. I'm not sure why this is the low season - perhaps we just had a particularly gorgeous week - but the days were hot and sunny with only intermittent rain showers (1-2 per day, lasting 30 minutes max), the prices were lower, and it was delightful to experience the island with fewer tourists. There were still plenty of tourists, however, which makes me wonder how packed things must get during the high season months.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel, welcome relief from congested areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 11 nights, was meant to be 6 but we extended. Absolutely fantastic, really relaxing and top service. Quite a small hotel, but wonderful. Not many places to walk to, so we ate almost every meal here - all were excellent, really top quality and a good variety.
reviews.title: Really Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff couldn’t do enough to help, and nothing was too much trouble for Eugene the manager and Yvonne the receptionist.
reviews.title: Perfect get away hotel!! Great staff!!
Perfect hotel for a relaxing end to our vacation
reviews.text: Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for the first couple of days of our honeymoon. We were greeted by Eugiene the manager who gave us an excellent welcome and tour around the hotel and its grounds. He was always happy to help with even the smallest things.
reviews.title: A romantic stay, fabulous staff

reviews.text: The room was lovely, cleaned well ever day and the dhow furniture was a lovely finishing touch and very unique. The facilities were great, lovely salt water infinty pool with fantastic views. The beach was nice although when the tide is in you can't really use it, but that wasn't a problem with the sand area in the hotel or the pool. The food was fantastic, always something different on the menu and always good!!
reviews.title: Really disappointed and expensive!

description: The Zanzibari is located in Nungwi on the northeastern tip of Zanzibar. Set above the beach on a low coral cliff with easy access to the sea you are offered privacy, peace and tranquility while taking in the stunning views of the Indian Ocean. The hotel has many high quality facilities, including our infinity pool, spa and famous Dhow Restaurant.
